meanings.definition: Able to be perceived or recognized.
meanings.sent1: The difference in color was discernable even from far away.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the bell was discernable amidst the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent3: The discernable smell of freshly baked cookies made everyone's mouths water.
meanings.sent4: Her discernable talent for painting shone brighter than any other artist's.
meanings.sent5: The discernable outline of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: The discernable pattern on the fabric made it unique.
meanings.sent2: His discernable accent revealed his origins.
meanings.sent3: The discernable mark on the wall showed where the ball had hit.
meanings.sent4: The discernable excitement in the room was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The discernable taste of the dish left a lasting impression.

meanings.sent1: The instructions were not discernable due to the smudged ink.
meanings.sent2: Her intentions were discernable through her actions.
meanings.sent3: The discernable plot twist in the movie caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: The discernable logic in his argument convinced many.
meanings.sent5: The discernable truth finally came to light after years of secrecy.
